intro: Heliophila deserticola var. deserticola, commonly known as the desert heliophyte, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low moisture. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. The flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in summer and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
